name: Oaks 212 Margaret

reviews.text: We stayed here in early jan 2010. all 12 of us !! (2 families with teens going to dreamworld and then onto a 7 day cruise) I was a little dubious at booking in here after reading a couple of "old" reviews here on T/A but this place has new management and it shows !! - IT WAS GREAT. The staff were excellent... the rooms we had (2 suites) were clean AND BIG and the location is perfect if you want to be right in the heart of brisbane... Excellent resturants and services very close by.
reviews.title: Well done guys..!

reviews.text: The front office staff need particular praise! - from the way our booking was handled thru to the checkout !
reviews.title: Lots of space: but its apartments, not really a hotel
Fantastic! What more can i say!
reviews.text: We would definitely stay here again.. WELL DONE TO 212 MARGARET

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I read some reviews about places like Oaks 212 and wonder what people are expecting. For under $200 in the heart of the CBD, I get a big bedroom, kitchen, comfy living area, laundry in the bathroom and a great balcony. If this were an hotel, I'd be paying $500 for this much space!! So, the reason there is no staff, no mini-bar, no room service, and no fancy foyers and fawning flunkies is that you pay for space not service. That's fine by me - the Oaks 212 is one of the better of these apartments if just a wee bit pricey. (Oaks owns a lot of properties in Brisbane and has a bit of a lock on the market IMO).
reviews.title: Would happily have stayed longer!

reviews.text: The Oaks on Margaret is a great place to stay for any amount of time if traveling alone or with a friend. Staff was helpful, and the conveniences are just right.
reviews.title: Clean, roomy, helpful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I did not try the breakfast at the hotel restaurant as there are plenty of inexpensive breakfast/coffee places right nearby.
reviews.title: Nice apartment- great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is close to shopping, nightlife and relaxation alike, all within walking distance.
reviews.title: Nice clean apartment, not too bad a location and helpful staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only minus was the nearby nighttime construction work on my first night, which was of course not the hotels fault. However, the surrounding area is very busy and it can be noisy at times.
reviews.title: Nice change from a hotel but a few problems

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for two nights over Easter weekend. The apartment was nicely fitted out with every thing we needed. The bed was big and comfy but the sheets were scratchy like hospital ones. We needed to cover the window in the bedroom as it was a bright as daylight. The pool, bbq and gym were great however the claim that the pool is heated to 24 degrees seems untrue- very chilly. There were only two lifts in a 30 level building and unfortunately one broke down during our stay which made for some very long waits for it.
reviews.title: Very Good Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked two nights in a 'one bedroom executive' apartment. Actually we were upgraded to a 2-bed (27th floor), but it made no difference since we weren't going to use the second bed and bath (for which we would have been charged an extra $50 per night). Everything was fine. Good, smooth check-in slightly ahead of advertised earliest. Big living room/kitchen and big bedroom. Bathroom OK but a silly little shower-head as someone else commented. Very big balcony/terrace with a splendid view of the botanic gardens, river and over to the Gabba. (But maybe not so good in high summer, because the aircon unit is out there too, presumably pumping out hot air.) Overall we were very pleasantly surprised that the Oaks on Margaret was so good. Very good location, but there is a big new development just started next door, so for the next 12 months there may well be construction noise.
reviews.title: Roomy, comfortable, well located and great view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Oaks 212 on Margaret is a great place to stay in central Brisbane.
reviews.title: Great Apartments in Central Brisbane

reviews.text: The rooms open onto a lounge (two couches) near the balcony with views across the Brisbane CBD. There's a full kitchen, meals area and separate bedroom and bathroom, so the rooms are very spacious.
reviews.title: Conveneint and spacious

reviews.text: We had 5 guests over and there was seating for everyone, and plenty of space to prepare and serve food.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay!

reviews.text: The location is within an easy walk of the botanic gardens, river, and Queen Street (where the mall is).
reviews.title: Not bad, but could have been so much better.

reviews.text: We stayed here in a two bedroomed apartment for 3 nights - and we wished we had stayed longer! We were given a room on the 24th floor with what can only be described as 'spectacular' views across the city and Botanical Gardens. We found the accommodation everything and more than we expected and the guys on the front desk were there for us with answers to any questions we asked. The room was serviced daily too, so no making of beds or switching on of the dish washer!!! The apartment was clean and tidy and at present there is a re-vamp going on too. We looked at the new rooms and were impressed by the standard. The only thing wrong with our apartment (if I had to pick fault) was a stain on the sofa - Big WOW of course this didn't bother us in the slightest and this just demonstrates the high level this accommodation provided. We fell lucky when booking this accommodation as the website we used gave us 3 nights for the price of 2 - Bargain.
reviews.title: What a Place to stay - and amazing views too

reviews.text: Ok, would I recommend this to everyone? Absolutely yes. But I would ask for a room with a view so you can enjoy the sights after you have finished sightseeing for the day. A glass of something alcoholic out on the balcony is just what the doctor ordered (bottle shop just around the corner too!)
reviews.title: Stunning Views

reviews.text: We got the airport transfer ($36 for 2 Ad, 1 Ch) to the apartment and had the craziest driver ever!!! Be warned those with a weak stomach - so we decided to get a taxi back to the domestic terminal at a cost of $43 door to door. Car hire is quite pricey here for some reason, so hope the above amounts help when you are planning your stay.
reviews.title: Can't beat my $ & View!
Camera Stolen from 26th floor room
reviews.text: Great value for money, Oaks provided a spacious, boutique style hotel with stunning views.

reviews.title: Beware 28 Day Cancellation for Online Bookings
reviews.text: While some reviews mention construction noise, that is no longer the case & serenity has been restored! The view from our apartment was sensational, looking out over the Botanic Gardens and Brisbane River.

description: Oaks 212 Margaret offers a range of luxurious one and two bedroom self contained apartments all with air conditioning and state of the art room facilities. There is also a luxury two storey four-bedroom penthouse which boasts the pinnacle of facilities, services and uninterrupted views. The hotel also has an in-house heated pool and gym.It is the perfect base from which to enjoy everything Brisbane has to offer. Cool café precincts and fine dining, theatres, nightclubs, busy streets and leafy corners. Enjoying breathtaking river, city and parkland views, 212 Margaret is just an easy stroll from the financial, commercial and shopping heart with its great restaurants and entertainment venues. Excellent access to public transport makes getting around a breeze.Adjacent to the Botanical Gardens, overlooking the Brisbane River, and yet only minutes from the CBD, Oaks 212 Margaret is a logical choice for you to explore Brisbane’s historic centre, entertainment options or when visiting for a conference or event.
